Detailed Description

This header defines the GTI APIs for controlling execution state (halt, run, step) of target device.

Copyright (c) 1998-2015, Texas Instruments Inc., All rights reserved.

Define Documentation

#define GTI_RUN_ATTR_CLOCK   0x10

Run single clock cycle (unused).

#define GTI_RUN_ATTR_FREE   0x04

Free run mode (debugging disabled).

#define GTI_RUN_ATTR_GB_ENABLED   0x100

Indicate that global breakpoints are enabled.

Run with interrupts disabled.

#define GTI_RUN_ATTR_LOW_PWR   0x40

Run in low power mode.

#define GTI_RUN_ATTR_PC_RESET_SINCE_LAST_RUN   0x200

Indicate that the PC was reseted by the debugger since last run.

#define GTI_RUN_ATTR_PROFILE   0x02

Run with profiling enabled.

#define GTI_RUN_ATTR_SYNC   0x01

Flags to customize the behavior of the execution APIs.

Used by GTI_HALT(), GTI_RUN_EX(), adn GTI_STEP(). Synchronous (global) run.

#define GTI_RUN_INFO_REV   0x1

Revision of the GTI_RUN_INFO structure.

#define GTI_SYNC_RUN_ROUTER   0x80

Synchronous (global) run via router (unused).

Function Documentation

GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_GLOBALSTART ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid )

GTI_GLOBALSTART() - Start a synchronous run.

This function starts the execution of a queue of synchronous execution commands. To queue up synchronous commands, call the desired execution APIs on each target with the GTI_RUN_ATTR_SYNC set in runAttrFlag. After the last target device has been queued, issue this call to any one of the targets in the queue.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_HALT ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_INT16_TYPE  runAttrFlag 
)

GTI_HALT() - Halt target device.

GTI_RUN() - Run target device.

This function halts execution of code on the target device. Set runAttrFlag to GTI_RUN_ATTR_SYNC to queue a synchronous run.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.

This function starts the execution of code on target device until an external event halts the target. The runAttrFlag parameter may be set to: GTI_RUN_ATTR_SYNC, GTI_RUN_ATTR_PROFILE, GTI_RUN_ATTR_FREE, or GTI_RUN_ATTR_LOW_PWR.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]runAttrFlagOptional attribute flags.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_RUN_EX ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_INT16_TYPE  runAttrFlag,
GTI_RUN_INFO *  additionalInfo 
)

GTI_RUN_EX() - Run target device for a number of instructions.

This function starts the execution of code on target device for a number of instructions. The runAttrFlag parameter may be set to: GTI_RUN_ATTR_SYNC, GTI_RUN_ATTR_PROFILE, GTI_RUN_ATTR_FREE, or GTI_RUN_ATTR_LOW_PWR. Set the m_count member of additionalInfo to a number to execute that number of instructions. Otherwise, set m_count to zero to execute code until an external event halts the target.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]runAttrFlagOptional attribute flags.
[in]additionalInfoAdditional parameters structure.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_STEP ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_INT16_TYPE  runAttrFlag 
)

GTI_STEP() - Single step target device.

This function executes a single step on the target device. Set runAttrFlag to GTI_RUN_ATTR_SYNC to queue a synchronous run. Set runAttrFlag to GTI_RUN_ATTR_INT_DISABLED to disable interrupts during the step.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]runAttrFlagOptional attribute flags.
